title: Update!
content:
What the heck have you gone and done with this all new version of Thunderbird. Surely you'd have tested it before it release. I had several email accounts in the old version and now the new version has lost these. I found them eventually buried at the bottom, but now its so difficult to go between these I don't want to use this downgraded version. Please switch us all back ASAP without loosing our email accounts etc.

As you will see from screen shot 1 every time I click on my old accounts it brings up a set up page, which the old version didn't do and I certainly don't want to set up all 6 accounts each time I use this terrible version.

As you will see from all the screen shots my right hand panel is so confusing I have no idea where anything is now, where as the old version was laid out in a much simpler and easy way, so why change it!

Its buried the emails at the bottom of the column where as before they were at the top for easy access.

I've now turned off automatic updates and wished it had never been on in the first place. Please fix this ASAP and let me know as I've had to turn off auto updates to stop this happening again.
creator: info9901

title: email monitoring
content: Hello, Is there anyone who can tell me if it is possible to check in the thunderbird dashboard if an email I have sent has been received, and/or if it has been opened my the recipient. Thank you for your support. Christiaano

title: Thunderbird Supernova - trash folder issue with multiple email accounts
content:
I just upgraded to Thunderbird Supernova 115.2.2 (32-bit). Noticed a few issues:

I have two email a/cs under Thunderbird. While I am able to delete messages in the trash folder for the first account, empty trash doesn't seem to work in the second account. When I select "Empty Trash" for this second account nothing is deleted and cursor seems to jump to the "New Message" button. I have to manually select the messages in the trash folder of the 2nd email account and delete them.

Appreciate any assistance.

Thanks, Ravi.
creator: r_anupindi

title: Can't see Inbox or Folders after Thunderbird update to 115.2.2
content:
Opened Thunderbird this morning to the new 115.2.2.

The first screen shows my previously open emails, with a blank tab at the start. (Screen shot attached)

No sign of my folders, and I have no idea how to find my inbox. Unusable in its current state.

Help seriously needed!
creator: mara1618

title: font type after update
content:
Today Thunderbird was automatically updated. I'm sorry to say for me it is not an improvement. Maybe it is focused on smartphones, which I only use to call someone and not for my email. I only check my mail on my pc. Besides that I don't like the layout, I have two questions that hopefully you can help me with:

1) Can I go back to the previous version? 2) If not, can you tell me if it is possible to change the font type of the index (I don't know how you call it, but where the maps are named and also where the mails are listed)? My eyes hurt when I look at the font that is used now. I did find out how the change the size of the fonts, but I would like to choose another one (the previous version was nice).

Hope this is possible or will meybe be available in the comming update.

Thanks in advance and kind regards, Marcel
creator: tdl23

title: Thunderbird 115 Move Application Menu (three-bar) to left hand side using CSS
content:
It is annoying when a redesign of Thunderbird (Supernova) says it gives maximum customization options, but in fact moves something - the Thunderbird/Application Menu icon (hamburger button) - whose position apparently can't be customized!

How can I move the Application Menu (three-bar, hamburger menu) from the right hand side to the left hand side in Thunderbird 115.2.2?

The following CSS code (inside userChrome.css, inside a newly created chrome folder in my profile) works for my Firefox program, but apparently does not work for Thunderbird 115.

/* Move the APPLICATION MENU, 3-bar button, to the left & change its color */ 

#PanelUI-button {  order:-1 !important;   color: yellow  }

Can anyone please tell me what the CSS code is to move the position of the Thunderbird/Application Menu? Many thanks, Rick
creator: RickW123

creator: ep2658

title: Text too small
content:
Just upgraded to "SUPERNOVA" (115.2.2) and the text (Drop downs, Folder Pane, message headers and Inbox) looks like it got hit by a black hole. Sorry folks, I'm getting old but I'd rather not wear reading glasses at the computer. Did not have this problem before the upgrade. I've checked the forum but the fixes do not work (also note the screen layout has changed some with the update). I can read the messages as they are both larger and subject to the zoom function.

While it may seem minor, for those of us who have been using TB for a many years and aging in the process this is a major problem. While the update, what I can see of it looks interesting, at present I am stuck with the horrible prospect of expanding my (forced) use of Outlook from just my work email to all my emails.

Is there a simple fix? And I would suggest this be fixed in an update.
creator: chessale

title: Configuring "Supernova" folder pane
content:
Hello, I was trying out the new options with Supernova's email folder pane, showing folder size, number of messages in the folder, and so on.

One of the options was hiding the mini-toolbar at the top of the pane, which normally has the additional get messages and new message buttons. (I'm not talking about the main Thunderbird toolbar, which has Get Messages, Write, Chat and so on—I mean the small one that appears at the top of the folder pane. I'll attach a screenshot to make it clear what I'm talking about.)

I tried hiding the mini-toolbar, but now I can't get it back, because the menu for doing so is on the toolbar which I just hid. I'm not sure if there is an option to re-enable the mini-toolbar somewhere else, and I just can't see it, or if the existence of this trap is a bug in the UI design.

Can anyone help? Thanks in advance.
